nodes.body:
### PR summary [58871899d7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21614/commits/58871899d7454d0e39a2d41f44e7f44f1feaed8e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Semisimple.Lemmas` (new file)|1878|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasCentralRadical`
`+ IsFaithful`
`+ LieSubmodule.eq_top_of_isIrreducible`
`+ center_eq_bot`
`+ commute_id_left`
`+ commute_id_right`
`+ ext_of_isFaithful`
`+ hasCentralRadical_and_of_isIrreducible_of_isFaithful`
`+ hasCentralRadical_of_radical_le`
`+ hasTrivialRadical_and_of_isIrreducible_of_isFaithful`
`+ instance [HasTrivialRadical R L] : LieModule.IsFaithful R L L := by`
`+ isFaithful_iff'`
`+ isFaithful_iff_ker_eq_bot`
`+ isFaithful_self_iff`
`+ ker_eq_bot`
`+ toEnd_eq_iff`
`+ toEnd_eq_zero_iff`
`- HasTrivialRadical.center_eq_bot`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13238995769/job/36949952804)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13238995769/job/36949953116)

I expect that we could get the lemmas in this file to work over any principal ideal domain (of characteristic zero) instead of a field. The plan I see would be to define the nilradical of a Lie algebra (currently missing) and use it with `LieModule.exists_nontrivial_weightSpace_of_isNilpotent` instead of using the solvable radical with Lie's theorem as we are doing here. The conclusion of this lemma would then make a statement that the nilradical vanishes. We would prove elsewhere that vanishing nilradical is equivalent to `HasCentralRadical`.

However I would like to leave this for future work, unless I receive strong encouragement to take this detour now.
I think it is fine to leave it as future work. But please record your observation as a comment in the file.

Could you please also provide an ext-lemma version. (It can't be tagged `@[ext]`, because it can't determine `M`.)
Basically `toEnd_eq_iff`, but spelled out with Lie brackets, and only the `.mpr` direction.
I guess it could be called `ext_of_isFaithful`.

Why are you removing this comment now?
Aha, I see, you moved it to the docstring of `HasCentralRadical`.

But maybe this docstring can point there?
```suggestion
/-- The two properties shown to be equivalent here are possible definitions for a Lie algebra
to be reductive.
See also `LieAlgebra.HasCentralRadical`. -/
```
Sadly that comment was wrong: it only assumes that the radical is abelian which is weaker than the radical being central!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: a finite-dimensional Lie algebra with a irreducible faithful finite-dimensional trace-free representation is semisimple
